answers.answer: I have deep chest cramps as I call them. They come on quickly, don't last long - less than a minute and then go away. I wore a monitor to record them as well as my other arrhythmia stuff. When I saw the cardio, he said he didn't have the results from the monitor but he didn't think it was cardio related. OK. He put me on a medication to control the arrhythmias a bit before I went into surgery. Amazingly enough, the chest cramps went away as well after a couple of weeks. Coincidence maybe. Bottom line is I don't know what causes mine. Most often they occur during strenuous activity and stop when I stop. If the doc isn't worried then I guess I won't worry either. Hope you get better answers.

question: My wife has insulin dependent diabetes for over 30 yrs (Type I), a former smoker, has had 4x bypass, and 4 stents since then in another artery that was not bypassed, 2 heart attacks diagnosed with blood work in the last 2 months in that same artery, and peripheral artery disease.  Recently shge told the dr that her chest pressure (feels like she is wearing a tight bra but she isn't) has returnd but sometimes it only stays for a minute or 2 and then goes.  Now this has happened to her always before a cardiac event and the dr tells her that if they come and go for only a minute or 2 (after exercise) then its not cardiac!  This is the same dr that has treated her for the last 4 years and she tells him this every time and he still isn't getting it.  Has anyone else ever experienced pain that comes and goes after exercise that sometimes only lasts a few minutes and then disappears until the next time (sometimes it can be 20 minutes later if she is overly active).  This goes on until it gets worse and then she starts getting them longer and longer and then eventually a cardiac episode occurs.  It has in the past anyway.  Anyone else have this few minute experience?  Or is it time to change drs?  Sad thing is everytime he tells her something like this, she does get sicker and he is from a very well known heart hospital.
title: Pain that comes & goes
